author: R Sivaraman
text:
The Elections Department is set to release final electoral rolls on Monday in the Union Territory which faces Assembly elections in a few months.

The department, over the past few weeks, has been making efforts to bring out error-free electoral rolls as per the instruction of the Election Commission of India.

Last September, the department released draft electoral rolls in all the constituencies and invited voters whose names were left out to include their names or effect change in the rolls. As per instruction of the EC, a special summary revision was conducted in all the Assembly constituencies from September 15 to October 14 for those. As per the draft electoral rolls, the Union Territory comprising the Puducherry, Karaikal, Mahe and Yanam regions has 7,50,711 voters, including 3,91,555 women and 3,59,115 men and 41 other voters.

With the publication of the draft rolls, the Elections Department said those aged 18 on January 1, 2016 could also apply for inclusion of their names in the rolls.

Special campaigns were conducted at the booth level. Arrangements were made for the public/ employees to file online applications through www.ceopondicherry.nic.in and to approach the polling station for obtaining forms and submitting their claims and objections, the officials said.
title: Final poll rolls in UT to be released today
